original_title: ASPI hits record 20,000 points but profit-takings emerge latterly
original_body_lines: CSE recorded a positive market trend for the 11th consecutive day yesterday and the All Share Price Index topped 20,000 points, rising 99 points in early trading. Subsequently heavy profit- takings were noted which pushed the market to a negative mood, market analysts said.

Turnover stood at Rs 4.52 billion with 11 crossings. Those crossings were reported in JKH, whose share price traded at Rs 24.70, CT Lands one million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 33 million; its shares traded at Rs 33, Ceylon Cold Stores 200,000 shares crossed for Rs 22.4 million; its shares traded at Rs 112, Royal Ceramic 500,000 shares crossed for Rs 22 million; its shares traded at Rs 44, Commercial Bank 120,000 shares crossed for Rs 21 million; its shares traded at Rs 174.75 and HNB 55000 shares crossed for Rs 20.6 million; its shares fetched Rs 374.

In the retail market companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; DFCC Rs 258 million (1.6 million shares traded), Pan Asian Bank Rs 254 million (4.4 million shares traded), JKH Rs 238 million (9.8 million shares traded), HNB Rs 216 million (579,000 shares traded), Royal Ceramic Rs 202 million (4.61 million shares traded), Sampath Bank Rs 146 million (one million shares traded) and NDB Rs 134 million (943,000 shares traded). During the day 157.5 million share volumes changed hands in 39707 transactions.
It is said that manufacturing sector led the market, especially JKH, while the banking and financial sector became the second largest contributor to the market, especially DFCC and HNB.

Yesterday, the rupee opened at Rs 301.10/22 to the US dollar in the spot market, relatively flat from Rs 301.20/30 the previous day, while bond yields held broadly steady, dealers said. The telegraphic transfer rates were: euro buying Rs 342.332 selling Rs 353.5380, British pound buying Rs 394.27 selling Rs 405.6214, American dollar buying Rs 297.7500 selling Rs 304.75.

A bond maturing on 15.10.2028 was quoted at 8.85/90 percent, up from 8.75/85 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.40/43 percent, up from 9.35/40 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2031 was quoted at 9.85/95 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.25/30 percent, from 10.23/26 percent.
